eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Update delayed position and delayed history of _PARAM0_

events.comment: Add the previous position to have enough (2) positions to evaluate the extra delay for waiting mode.
Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX))
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY))
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
* Stick accessories to moving objects
* Animate a skeleton
* Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctions.name: Stick

eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DialogBox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
description: ## Summary
This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
## How to use:
1. You will need a background **sprite**, a character **sprite**, a **BBText** to display the name, a **BBText** to display the text, and a **sprite** for the icon to prompt the player for action.
1. Add the "Dialog Box" behavior to the background object.
1. Place each object in the scene.
1. Execute the "Setup Dialog Box" action only once in the event.
1. After that, execute the "Open Dialog Box" action, "Close Dialog Box" action, etc.
## This extension add:
**Dialog Box** - behavior
**Setup Dialog Box** - action
**Open Dialog Box** - action
**Close Dialog Box** - action
**Change Dialog Box Text** - action
**Change Dialog Box contents** - action
**Change Dialog Box typing sound** - action
**Change Dialog Box typing interval** - action
**Skip Dialog Box typing** - action
**Dialog Box is open** - condition
**Dialog Box is typing** - condition
**Dialog Box is close** - condition
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - condition
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - expression
## Tips
This Dialog Box has a useful counter function.
It is zero when the dialog box is opened, and increases by one each time the text changes.
(However, it will not increase until the frame advances).
This feature is useful for keeping track of the progress of a conversation.
## Note
In typing, style tags in BBText OBjects are also counted as characters.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
It handles:
- Cooldown between shots
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
- Ammo management
- Overheat
It can be used for:
- Twin-stick shooters ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://conviction-of-gun-dude-desktop))
- Shoot'em up ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.

Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds easy to use pre-made animations.
description: Helpful for making animations for sprites without having to spend time animating the character in editors
- You can use multi animations on one object to get more effects
- For the animations that do Not have Trigger once, you can use Timers to make it Have one !
- Added condition to check if the door is Open or Close from animation (3D open/close door)
- Added condition to check if the animation has finished (if trigger once set to YES)
- User can change the origin point of the object to control the animations
- Animation behavior must be installed in the object to make the extension works

eventsFunctions.description: From *3D open door* animation.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the door is open
eventsFunctions.name: DoorIsOpen

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the selected animation has finished.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if the animation has finished
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationFinished

parameters.longDescription: Animation must be set to Trigger once in order to check if it finished
parameters.name: animations
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["Pulse","Breath","Smooth rotation","Instant rotation","3D rotation","3D rotation X","3D rotation Y","Float","Triangle transition","Square transition","Rhombus transition","Maze transition","Fade out","Fade in","Squash & Stretch","Rainbow effect","Shake rotation","Shake horizontal","Shake vertical","Line rotation","Land","Low health"]

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate any sprite with this extension.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimationBehavior

eventsFunctions.description: edit the object ("Origin" point) to control how the animation goes.
eventsFunctions.name: AnimationSystem
eventsFunctions.sentence: Animate _PARAM0_ with animation _PARAM2_ at speed _PARAM3_ on width _PARAM4_ and height _PARAM5_ Trigger once? _PARAM6_

parameters.name: animations
parameters.supplementaryInformation: ["Pulse","Breath","Smooth rotation","Instant rotation","Wobble","Wobble2","Wobble3","3D rotation","3D rotation X","3D rotation Y","3D door loop","3D open door","3D close door","Float","Triangle transition","Square transition","Rhombus transition","Maze transition","Fade loop","Fade out","Fade in","Squash & Stretch","Rainbow effect","Shake rotation","Shake horizontal","Shake vertical","Line rotation","Land","Low health"]

parameters.longDescription:
Animations information:  
Pulse/Breath: recommended speed, 0.03  
Smooth rotation: recommended speed, 5  
Wobble/wobble2/wobble3: Do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 0.1  
3D rotation: recommended speed, 1  
3D rotationX: recommended speed, 1.2  
3D rotationY: Origin point must be at center/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D door loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 1.2  
3D open/close door: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 1.2  
Float: recommended speed, 0.02  
Triangle/Square/Rhombus/Maze transition: recommended speed, 3  
Fade loop: do not have trigger once/ recommended speed, 5  
Fade Out/In: Trigger once must be YES/ recommended speed, 5  
Squash&Stretch: recommended speed, 0.06  
Rainbow effect: The higher the speed the slower effect/ recommended speed, 1  
Shake rotation/Horizontal/Vertical: recommended speed, 4  
Line rotation: recommended speed, 3  
Land: Trigger once must be YES/ Best results, set the condition of the player to "is on floor" > start animation land / recommended speed, 5  
Low health: recommended speed, 30
parameters.name: height
